decks.notes: This Aggro-Maverick Legacy deck focuses on disruptive creatures and efficient removal spells to control the board while applying pressure with threats like Knight of the Reliquary and Leovold, Emissary of Trest. The deck utilizes cards like Swords to Plowshares and Abrupt Decay to deal with opposing threats, while also having access to powerful tutor effects like Green Sun's Zenith. With a versatile mana base and access to hate cards like Gaddock Teeg and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly closing out the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with creatures like Steppe Lynx, Delver of Secrets, and True-Name Nemesis, while disrupting their game plan with spells like Force of Will, Daze, and Meddling Mage. The deck also includes efficient cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure card selection and draw. The mana base is built to support the deck's aggressive gameplay, with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent color access and the ability to disrupt the opponent's mana base with Wasteland.

The deck focuses on using control elements like counterspells, removal spells, and critical spells like True-Name Nemesis and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Stoneforge Mystic is used to search for powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull, providing additional ways to control the game and pressure the opponent. The mana base is optimized for consistency and disruption, with key lands like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and grind out incremental advantages to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana through rituals and mana rocks like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond to cast a high storm count spell like Tendrils of Agony to deal lethal damage to the opponent in one turn. It also includes card draw and selection spells like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Gitaxian Probe to find the necessary combo pieces. The deck also includes disruption like Duress and Cabal Therapy to protect the combo and interact with the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through a powerful storm combo.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize powerful card draw and mana acceleration to quickly assemble the resources needed to cast a series of spells that generate a high storm count. By chaining together spells like Dark Ritual, Rite of Flame, and Infernal Tutor, the deck aims to generate enough storm count to win the game through spells like Empty the Warrens or Ad Nauseam. The inclusion of Burning Wish allows for additional flexibility in accessing sideboard options to enhance the deck's combo potential.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly and efficiently cheat massive creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play through the use of cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience. This combo deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with huge threats that are difficult to deal with, allowing the player to win the game in a few decisive turns. The deck also includes a number of cantrips and counterspells to help find and protect the combo pieces, making it a powerful and consistent option in Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of countermagic, discard spells, removal, and powerful creatures. It aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent with card advantage and versatile threats. The deck is built around a strong mana base that allows for casting a variety of spells efficiently and includes powerful cards like Snapcaster Mage, Leovold, Emissary of Trest, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to generate incremental advantage and control the game. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Kolaghan's Command to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counter spells, removal, and card selection. By utilizing cards like Counterbalance, Force of Will, and Predict, the player can disrupt their opponent's strategy while digging through their own deck for key cards. Terminus and Supreme Verdict act as board wipes to clear the field of threats, while Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides card advantage and control over the game. The deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on using various spells and abilities to quickly put powerful creatures into play from the graveyard, such as Griselbrand, Grave Titan, and Iona, Shield of Emeria. The deck features cards like Entomb and Reanimate to easily fill the graveyard with creatures, while cards like Exhume and Animate Dead allow for the quick resurrection of these creatures. Additionally, the deck includes combo pieces like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a powerful token-generating engine. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats early in the game.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with lands that produce multiple mana, enabling early plays of powerful Eldrazi creatures. By using cards like Chalice of the Void and Sorcerous Spyglass, it aims to disrupt opponent's strategies, while also having removal options like All Is Dust and Warping Wail to deal with threats. The key strategy revolves around deploying huge Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer to apply pressure and overwhelm the opponent quickly, creating a fast and aggressive tempo that can be hard to stop.

The main focus of this UWx Control deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The deck utilizes cards like Force of Will, Counterspell, and Snapcaster Mage to control the board while also utilizing card draw with Brainstorm and Predict. The deck also includes board wipes like Terminus and removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to maintain control. It aims to outvalue the opponent and ultimately win through powerful finishers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Entreat the Angels.

The deck utilizes a combination of fast mana sources, card draw, and disruption to quickly assemble the resources needed for a powerful storm combo. By generating a high storm count through spells like Rite of Flame and Dark Ritual, the deck can cast spells like Infernal Tutor and Burning Wish multiple times in a turn, allowing for explosive plays. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a massive amount of spells in a single turn, ultimately leading to a game-winning victory. It's all about chaining spells together efficiently to create a storm of devastating power.

The main focus of this deck is to play aggressively and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Stifle, Wasteland, and Daze. By using efficient spells like Lightning Bolt, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce, the deck aims to control the game while also putting pressure on the opponent with creatures like Nimble Mongoose and Delver of Secrets. The deck also utilizes cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the right cards at the right time, allowing it to maintain its aggressive tempo throughout the match.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly get out big creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack, along with Omniscience to cast them for free. The deck includes a lot of card draw and protection spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to help ensure the combo goes off smoothly. By ramping up mana with Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures early in the game.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly ramp out powerful Eldrazi creatures using lands like Eye of Ugin, Eldrazi Temple, and City of Traitors. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void to shut down opponents' strategies. With the help of fast mana accelerants like Simian Spirit Guide and Ancient Tomb, the deck aims to swarm the board with Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Endbringer to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game quickly.

The deck aims to quickly control the board and apply pressure to the opponent through a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells. It utilizes cards like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler to establish a consistent threat presence while using counter spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By applying pressure early and consistently, the deck aims to outpace and overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own board presence or mount a defense.
